reviews.review_msg: COGS 300/PHIL 332 with Donaldson was very easy and mostly interesting. He is a great lecturer and asks for students feedback often during class. The lectures often become discussions between students and the prof, amazing! He marks assignments and tests rather leniently so prepare to get a good mark in his class.
interesting material... but no clear statement of expectations for evaluation. This class was a third year class that was conducted like a grad seminar.

He wrote the textbook which doubled as notes and give it to us for free (digital). There was a lot to remember, and small mistakes could go very bad. The weekly assignment were worth a lot. I will try to take another class with him. He is the best prof in arts I've had so far. please note that this is a hard class....

Lecture heavy class, he can easily hold my attention for the 2-hour class. Nick let me enter the while not yet meeting the prerequisites (few credits short). He goes at a pace that is reasonable for the average student. Nick's version of version of COGS300 is not too rigorous, easy to be above average. HW assignments are worth like 6 * 5% each
